definition: index (loanword)

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: Her screams brought the neighbours running.
sentences.chinese: 她的惊叫声引得邻居们都跑来了。

sentences.english: His jokes set the whole room in an uproar.
sentences.chinese: 他的笑话引得全屋的人哄堂大笑。

sentences.english: That was a campaign promise, " Obama replied to the pet question, drawing audience laughter.
sentences.chinese: 那是选举时的承诺，”奥巴马回答道，引得观众大笑。

sentences.english: Evenings bring couples and singles for concert.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚引得成双成对和单身的男女去听音乐会。

sentences.english: The little boy spoke English very well, which surprised all of us.
sentences.chinese: 那小家伙英语讲得很好，这引得举座皆惊。

sentences.english: My dog's hair bristles in response.
sentences.chinese: 这些猫的哀叫引得我的狗毛发竖立。

sentences.english: That understanding can lead to compassion which can lead to forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 这点理解或许可以引得同情并达成对父母的谅解。

sentences.english: She pointed ahead and directed him to turn left.
sentences.chinese: 她指向他的前方引得他向左。

sentences.english: He's so funny. He always makes me laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他真逗，他总是引得我笑。

sentences.english: The professor is drawing up an index for the teaching and research review materials.
sentences.chinese: 教授正在为教研复习资料编制引得。

sentences.english: The more often a fish is nearly caught, the more difficult it will be to interest it next time.
sentences.chinese: 一条鱼逃脱的次数越多，下一次就越难引得它上钩。

sentences.english: He spoofed the movement of his boss , which set everybody laughing.
sentences.chinese: 他惟妙惟肖模仿他老板的动作引得大家一阵大笑。

sentences.english: He spoofed the movement of his boss, which set everybody laughing.
sentences.chinese: 他惟妙惟肖模仿他老板的动作引得大家一阵大笑。

sentences.english: Consider the kerfuffle about last week's Peter Kenyon statements.
sentences.chinese: 上周，肯扬所做的声明差点儿引得天下大乱。

sentences.english: Throughout history, the beautiful city of Hangzhou has attracted numerous literary tourists.
sentences.chinese: 从古至今，美丽的杭州引得无数文人骚客留恋忘返。

sentences.english: Planted plane trees, attracted to Phoenix.
sentences.chinese: 栽下梧桐树，引得凤凰来。

definition: to stand in a circle and watch
to raise eyebrows/to cast sidelong glances (expressing fear or indignation)/shocked/surprised
to fall over each other in their eagerness to...
to discuss spiritedly (idiom)/tongues are wagging
variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]
in uproar/commotion/causing a storm of protest/tumultuous
one after another/in succession/one by one/continuously/diverse/in profusion/numerous and confused/pell-mell
to win/to gain
to acclaim/to cheer
endlessly/incessantly
to screech/to shriek
to applaud/to cheer
competitive/eagerly/to vie
off the stage/in the audience
to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
to cry out in alarm or surprise
everyone
